members.name: getView
members.comment: Returns the JLayer's view component or null. This is a bound property.

return: the JLayer's view component or null if none exists

members.name: setView
members.comment: Sets the JLayer's view component, which can be null. This is a bound property.

members.name: setUI
members.comment: Sets the LayerUI which will perform painting and receive input events for this JLayer.

members.name: getUI
members.comment: Returns the LayerUI for this JLayer.

members.name: getGlassPane
members.comment: Returns the JLayer's glassPane component or null. This is a bound property.

return: the JLayer's glassPane component or null if none exists

members.name: setGlassPane
members.comment: Sets the JLayer's glassPane component, which can be null. This is a bound property.

members.name: createGlassPane
members.comment: Called by the constructor methods to create a default glassPane. By default this method creates a new JPanel with visibility set to true and opacity set to false.

members.name: setLayout
members.comment: Sets the layout manager for this container. This method is overridden to prevent the layout manager from being set. Note: If mgr is non-null, this method will throw an exception as layout managers are not supported on a JLayer.

throws: IllegalArgumentException - this method is not supported

members.name: setBorder
members.comment: Delegates its functionality to the getView().setBorder(Border) method, if the view component is an instance of javax.swing.JComponent, otherwise this method is a no-op.

param: border - the border to be rendered for the view component

members.name: getBorder
members.comment: Delegates its functionality to the getView().getBorder() method, if the view component is an instance of javax.swing.JComponent, otherwise returns null.

return: the border object for the view component

members.name: addImpl
members.comment: This method is not supported by JLayer and always throws UnsupportedOperationException

param: constraints - an object expressing layout constraints for this component
index - the position in the container's list at which to insert the component, where -1 means append to the end
throws: UnsupportedOperationException - this method is not supported

members.name: isPaintingOrigin
members.comment: Always returns true to cause painting to originate from JLayer, or one of its ancestors.

members.name: paintImmediately
members.comment: Delegates its functionality to the LayerUI.paintImmediately(int, int, int, int, JLayer) method, if LayerUI is set.

param: x - the x value of the region to be painted
y - the y value of the region to be painted
w - the width of the region to be painted
h - the height of the region to be painted

members.name: imageUpdate
members.comment: Delegates its functionality to the LayerUI.imageUpdate(java.awt.Image, int, int, int, int, int, JLayer) method, if the LayerUI is set.

see: ImageObserver, Graphics.drawImage(Image, int, int, Color, java.awt.image.ImageObserver), Graphics.drawImage(Image, int, int, java.awt.image.ImageObserver), Graphics.drawImage(Image, int, int, int, int, Color, java.awt.image.ImageObserver), Graphics.drawImage(Image, int, int, int, int, java.awt.image.ImageObserver), ImageObserver.imageUpdate(java.awt.Image, int, int, int, int, int)
return: false if the infoflags indicate that the image is completely loaded; true otherwise.

members.name: paint
members.comment: Delegates all painting to the LayerUI object.

members.name: paintComponent
members.comment: This method is empty, because all painting is done by paint(Graphics) and ComponentUI.update(Graphics, JComponent) methods

members.name: isOptimizedDrawingEnabled
members.comment: The JLayer overrides the default implementation of this method (in JComponent) to return false. This ensures that the drawing machinery will call the JLayer's paint implementation rather than messaging the JLayer's children directly.

members.name: propertyChange
members.comment: This method gets called when a bound property is changed.

param: evt - A PropertyChangeEvent object describing the event source and the property that has changed.

members.name: setLayerEventMask

param: layerEventMask - the bitmask of event types to receive

members.name: getLayerEventMask
members.comment: Returns the bitmap of event mask to receive by this JLayer and its LayerUI. It means that LayerUI.eventDispatched(AWTEvent, JLayer) method will only receive events that match the event mask. By default JLayer receives no events.

return: the bitmask of event types to receive for this JLayer

members.name: updateUI
members.comment: Delegates its functionality to the LayerUI.updateUI(JLayer) method, if LayerUI is set.

members.name: getPreferredScrollableViewportSize
members.comment: Returns the preferred size of the viewport for a view component. If the view component of this layer implements Scrollable, this method delegates its implementation to the view component.

return: the preferred size of the viewport for a view component

members.name: getScrollableBlockIncrement
members.comment: Returns a scroll increment, which is required for components that display logical rows or columns in order to completely expose one block of rows or columns, depending on the value of orientation. If the view component of this layer implements Scrollable, this method delegates its implementation to the view component.

param: visibleRect - The view area visible within the viewport
direction - Less than zero to scroll up/left, greater than zero for down/right.
return: the "block" increment for scrolling in the specified direction

members.name: getScrollableTracksViewportHeight
members.comment: Returns false to indicate that the height of the viewport does not determine the height of the layer, unless the preferred height of the layer is smaller than the height of the viewport. If the view component of this layer implements Scrollable, this method delegates its implementation to the view component.

return: whether the layer should track the height of the viewport

members.name: getScrollableTracksViewportWidth
members.comment: Returns false to indicate that the width of the viewport does not determine the width of the layer, unless the preferred width of the layer is smaller than the width of the viewport. If the view component of this layer implements Scrollable, this method delegates its implementation to the view component.

return: whether the layer should track the width of the viewport

members.name: getScrollableUnitIncrement
members.comment: Returns a scroll increment, which is required for components that display logical rows or columns in order to completely expose one new row or column, depending on the value of orientation. Ideally, components should handle a partially exposed row or column by returning the distance required to completely expose the item. Scrolling containers, like JScrollPane, will use this method each time the user requests a unit scroll. If the view component of this layer implements Scrollable, this method delegates its implementation to the view component.

param: visibleRect - The view area visible within the viewport
direction - Less than zero to scroll up/left, greater than zero for down/right.
return: The "unit" increment for scrolling in the specified direction. This value should always be positive.

members.name: doLayout
members.comment: Delegates its functionality to the LayerUI.doLayout(JLayer) method, if LayerUI is set.

members.name: getAccessibleContext
members.comment: Gets the AccessibleContext associated with this JLayer.
Creates a new JLayer object with a null view component and default LayerUI.
Creates a new JLayer object with default LayerUI.

param: view - the component to be decorated by this JLayer

members.comment: Creates a new JLayer object with the specified view component and LayerUI object.

param: ui - the LayerUI delegate to be used by this JLayer
